classes.name: CircuitConnectionRouter
classes.description:
Provides a {@link draw2d.Connection} with an orthogonal route between the Connection's source and target anchors.
Additional a bridge is added to each connection which didn't have a common source or target port.
A dot is added at the crossing if the two connections have a common spurce or target port.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object.

functions.name: onInstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been assigned to a connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The assigned connection

functions.name: onUninstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been removed from the connection. In the case of the CircuitRouter all vertex nodes will be removed from the canvas.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The related connection

functions.name: setVertexRadius
functions.description: Set the radius of the vertex circle.

functions.name: setJunctionRadius
functions.description: deprecated

functions.name: setBridgeRadius
functions.description: Set the radius or span of the bridge. A bridge will be drawn if two connections are crossing and didn't have any common port.

functions.name: route
functions.description: Routes the Connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The Connection to route

parameters.name: routingHints
parameters.description: some helper attributes for the router

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved
parameters.description: is true if just the start location has moved

parameters.name: routingHints.endMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

parameters.name: routingHints.oldVertices
parameters.description: the vertices before the reroute has been triggered

functions.name: _route
functions.description: Internal routing algorithm.

functions.name: canRemoveVertexAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to check if it possible to remove a vertex from the list. The router can send an veto for this. Per default it is not possible to remove any vertex from the PolyLine exceptional if any interactive router is installed.

functions.name: canRemoveSegmentAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to verify that a segment is deletable.

functions.name: getPersistentAttributes
functions.description: Tweak or enrich the polyline persistence data with routing information

parameters.name: memento
parameters.description: The memento data of the polyline

functions.name: setPersistentAttributes
functions.description: set the attributes for the polyline with routing information

parameters.name: memento
parameters.description: the JSON data to read

functions.name: onDrag
functions.description: The draw2d.Connection delegates the drag operation to the router. The router can handle the different constraints of the connection.

parameters.name: dx
parameters.description: the x difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dy
parameters.description: the y difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dx2
parameters.description: The x diff since the last call of this dragging operation

parameters.name: dy2
parameters.description: The y diff since the last call of this dragging operation

functions.name: verticesSet
functions.description: Called by the connection if the vertices set outside. This enforce the router to avoid full autoroute. E.g. InteractiveManhattanRouter

constructor.name: CircuitConnectionRouter

classes.name: FanConnectionRouter
classes.description: Automatic router that spreads its {@link draw2d.Connection Connections} in a fan-like fashion upon collision.

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved

parameters.name: routingHints.destMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

functions.description: route the connection if connections overlap. Two connections overlap if the combination of source and target anchors are equal.

classes.name: InteractiveManhattanConnectionRouter
classes.description: Route the connection in an Manhattan style and add resize handles to all vertex for interactive alignment of the routing.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object.

functions.name: halfRoute
functions.description: The routing algorithm if the user has changed at least on of the vertices manually. This kind of routing just align the start and end vertices to the new source/target port location. The vertices between keep untouched. Modification of this vertices are done by the draw2d.policy.line.OrthogonalSelectionFeedbackPolicy

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: the connection to route

parameters.name: routingHints
parameters.description: some helper attributes for the router

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved
parameters.description: is true if just the start location has moved

parameters.name: routingHints.endMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

functions.name: canRemoveSegmentAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to verify that a segment is deletable.

functions.name: onDrag
functions.description: The draw2d.Connection delegates the drag operation to the router. The router can handle the different constraints of the connection and just drag&drop a single segment instead of the complete connection.

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: the related line to handle

parameters.name: dx
parameters.description: the x difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dy
parameters.description: the y difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dx2
parameters.description: The x diff since the last call of this dragging operation

parameters.name: dy2
parameters.description: The y diff since the last call of this dragging operation

parameters.name: memento

functions.description: set the attributes for the polyline with routing information of the interactive manhattan router.

functions.name: getEndDirection
functions.description:
• up -> 0
  • right -> 1
  • down -> 2
  • left -> 3

functions.name: getStartDirection
functions.description:
• up -> 0
  • right -> 1
  • down -> 2
  • left -> 3

functions.name: getDirection
functions.description: Returns the direction the point p is in relation to the given rectangle. Possible values are LEFT (-1,0), RIGHT (1,0), UP (0,-1) and DOWN (0,1).

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: the rectangle

parameters.name: p
parameters.description: the point
